facts: Ultimate Renaissance polymath: artist, inventor, scientist, engineer, and anatomist (1452-1519)
Painted the Mona Lisa and The Last Supper, two of the world's most famous artworks
Designed flying machines, tanks, submarines, and parachutes centuries before they were built
Conducted detailed anatomical studies by dissecting human corpses, advancing medical knowledge
Wrote his notes in mirror script (backwards) for privacy and possibly due to left-handedness
Studied water flow, plant growth, rock formations, and cloud movements to understand nature
Apprenticed under Andrea del Verrocchio in Florence, learning painting and sculpture
Left many works unfinished as his curiosity led him to constantly pursue new projects
